arabicText: إِن تَكْفُرُوا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ عَنكُمْ ۖ وَلَا يَرْضَىٰ لِعِبَادِهِ ٱلْكُفْرَ ۖ وَإِن تَشْكُرُوا۟ يَرْضَهُ لَكُمْ ۗ وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌۭ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ ۗ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُم مَّرْجِعُكُمْ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
englishTranslationText:
If	you	become	ungrateful,	then	(know	that)	
indeed	Allah	is	Independent	of	you;	and	He	
does	not	like	the	ungratefulness	of	His	
bondmen;	and	if	you	give	thanks,	He	is	
pleased	with	it	for	you;	and	no	burdened	
soul	will	bear	another	soul’s	burden;	you	
have	then	to	return	towards	your	Lord	–	
He	will	therefore	inform	you	of	what	you	
used	to	do;	undoubtedly,	He	knows	what	
lies	within	the	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	tum	nā-shukri	karo	to	be-shak	Allāh	
be-niyāz	hai	tum	se	aur	apne	bandoñ	ki	nā
shukri	usey	pasand	nahiñ	aur	agar	sukr	
karo	to	usey	tumhāre	liye	pasand	farmātā	
hai	aur	koyi	bojh	uthāne	wāli	jān	dosre	kā	
bojh	nahiñ	uthāye	gi	phir	tumheñ	apne	rab	
hi	ki	ṭaraf	phirnā	hai	to	woh	tumheñ	batā	de	
gā	jo	tum	karte	the	be-shak	woh	diloñ	ki	bāt	
jāntā	hai.

arabicText: ۞ وَإِذَا مَسَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ ضُرٌّۭ دَعَا رَبَّهُۥ مُنِيبًا إِلَيْهِ ثُمَّ إِذَا خَوَّلَهُۥ نِعْمَةًۭ مِّنْهُ نَسِىَ مَا كَانَ يَدْعُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِ مِن قَبْلُ وَجَعَلَ لِلَّهِ أَندَادًۭا لِّيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ ۚ قُلْ تَمَتَّعْ بِكُفْرِكَ قَلِيلًا ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	some	hardship	strikes	man,	he	
prays	to	his	Lord,	inclined	only	towards	
Him	–	then	when	Allah	grants	him	a	favour	
from	Himself,	he	forgets	why	he	had	
prayed	to	Him	earlier,	and	sets	up	equals	
to	Allah	in	order	to	mislead	from	Allah’s	
way;	proclaim,	“Revel	in	your	disbelief	for	
some	days;	you	are	indeed	of	the	people	of	
the	fire.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	āadmi	ko	koyi	taklif	pahuñchti	hai	
apne	Rab	ko	pukārtā	hai	usi	ṭāraf	jhukā	huā	
phir	jab	Allāh	ne	usey	apne	pās	se	koyi	
n'emat	di	to	bhool	jātā	hai	jis	liye	pahle	
pukārā	thā	aur	Allāh	ke	liye	barābar	wāle	
thahrāne	lagṭā	hai	take	us	ki	rāh	se	bhakā	
de	tum	farmāō	thode	din	apne	kufr	ke	sāth	
barat	le	be-shak	tu	dozakhiyoñ	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: أَمَّنْ هُوَ قَـٰنِتٌ ءَانَآءَ ٱلَّيْلِ سَاجِدًۭا وَقَآئِمًۭا يَحْذَرُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ وَيَرْجُوا۟ رَحْمَةَ رَبِّهِۦ ۗ قُلْ هَلْ يَسْتَوِى ٱلَّذِينَ يَعْلَمُونَ وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ۗ إِنَّمَا يَتَذَكَّرُ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
Will	he,	whose	night	hours	pass	in	
obedience	while	prostrating	and	standing,	fearing	the	Hereafter	and	hoping	for	the	mercy	of	his	
Lord,	ever	be	equal	to	the	disobedient?	Proclaim,	“Are	the	knowledgeable	and	the	ignorant	
equal?”	It	is	only	the	men	of	intellect	who	heed	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	woh	jise	farmāñ	bardāri	meiñ	rāt	ki	ghadiyāñ	guzriñ	sujood	meiñ	aur	qiyām	meiñ	Āakhirat	
se	dartā	aur	apne	Rab	ki	Raḥmat	ki	āas	lagāye	kyā		woh	nāfarmānoñ	jaisā	ho	jāye	gā	tum	farmāo	
kyā		barābar	haiñ	jānne	wāle	aur	anjān	nasiḥat	to	wahi	mānte	haiñ	jo	'aql	wāle	haiñ.

arabicText: قُلْ يَـٰعِبَادِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌۭ ۗ وَأَرْضُ ٱللَّهِ وَٰسِعَةٌ ۗ إِنَّمَا يُوَفَّى ٱلصَّـٰبِرُونَ أَجْرَهُم بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“O	my	slaves	who	have	
accepted	faith!	Fear	your	Lord;	for	those	who	do	good	deeds	in	this	world	is	goodness	(in	return);	
and	Allah’s	earth	is	spacious;	it	is	the	steadfast	who	will	be	paid	their	full	reward,	without	
account.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	aey	mere	bando!	Jo	Imān	lāye	apne	Rab	se	daro	jinhoñ	ne	bhalāyi	ki	un	ke	liye	is	
duniyā	meiñ	bhalāyi	hai	aur	Allāh	ki	zameen	wasi'a	hai	sābiroñ	hi	ko	un	kā	sawāb	bharpoor	diyā	
jāye	gā	be-ginti.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنِّىٓ أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصًۭا لَّهُ ٱلدِّينَ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“I	am	commanded	that	I	must	worship	
Allah	as	His	sincere	bondman.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	mujhe	ḥukm	hai	ke	Allāh	ko	
pujooñ	nirā	us	kā	banda	ho	kar.

arabicText: وَأُمِرْتُ لِأَنْ أَكُونَ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	I	am	commanded	that	I	be	the	first	to	
submit.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mujhe	ḥukm	hai	ke	maiñ	sab	se	pahle	
garden	rakhoñ.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّى عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Say,	“Were	I	to	disobey	my	Lord,	I	too	
would	fear	the	punishment	of	the	great	
Day	(of	Resurrection).”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	bilfarz	agar	mujh	se	nā	
farmāni	ho	jāye	to	mujhe	bhi	apne	rab	se	
aik	bade	din	ke	'aƶāb	kā	dar	hai.

arabicText: قُلِ ٱللَّهَ أَعْبُدُ مُخْلِصًۭا لَّهُۥ دِينِى
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“I	worship	only	Allah,	as	His	
sincere	bondman.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	maiñ	Allāh	hi	ko	poojtā	hoñ	
nirā	us	kā	banda	ho	kar.

arabicText: فَٱعْبُدُوا۟ مَا شِئْتُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَأَهْلِيهِمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۗ أَلَا ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْخُسْرَانُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	you	can	worship	what	you	
want	besides	Him!”	Say,	“The	worst	losers	
are	those	who	will	lose	themselves	and	
their	household	on	the	Day	of	
Resurrection;	pay	heed!	This	is	the	plain	
loss!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	us	ke	siwā	jise	chāho	poojo	tum	
farmāo	poori	hār	unheñ	jo	apni	jān	aur	
apne	ghar	wāle	Qiyāmat	ke	din	hār	baithe	
hāñ	hāñ	yahi	khuli	hār	hai.

arabicText: لَهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ ظُلَلٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ وَمِن تَحْتِهِمْ ظُلَلٌۭ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦ عِبَادَهُۥ ۚ يَـٰعِبَادِ فَٱتَّقُونِ
englishTranslationText:
Above	them	are	mountains	of	fire	and	
beneath	them	are	mountains	of	fire;	Allah	
scares	His	bondmen	with	this;	“O	My	
bondmen!	Fear	Me!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	ūpar	āag	ke	pahād	haiñ	aur	un	ke	
niche	pahād	us	se	Allāh	darātā	hai	apne	
bandoñ	ko	aey	mere	bando!	tum	mujhe	se	
daro.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ ٱجْتَنَبُوا۟ ٱلطَّـٰغُوتَ أَن يَعْبُدُوهَا وَأَنَابُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ لَهُمُ ٱلْبُشْرَىٰ ۚ فَبَشِّرْ عِبَادِ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	who	stayed	away	from	the	
worship	of	idols,	and	inclined	towards	
Allah	–	for	them	are	glad	tidings;	therefore	
give	glad	tidings	to	My	bondmen.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	butoñ	ki	poojā	se	bachche	aur	
Allāh	ki	ṭaraf	ruju'	huye	unhiñ	ke	liye	
khushkhabri	hai	to	khushi	sunāo	Mere	un	
bandoñ	ko.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يَسْتَمِعُونَ ٱلْقَوْلَ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ أَحْسَنَهُۥٓ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ هَدَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمْ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	heed	attentively	and	follow	the	
best	from	it;	it	is	these	whom	Allah	has	
guided,	and	it	is	these	who	have	
intelligence.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	kān	lagā	kar	bāt	suneñ	phir	us	ke	behtar	
par	chaleñ	ye	haiñ	jin	ko	Allāh	ne	hidāyat	
farmāyi	aur	ye	haiñ	jin	ko	'aql	hai.

arabicText: أَفَمَنْ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِ كَلِمَةُ ٱلْعَذَابِ أَفَأَنتَ تُنقِذُ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
So	will	the	one	upon	whom	the	Word	of	
punishment	has	proved	true,	ever	be	equal	to	those	who	are	forgiven?	So	will	you	guide	and	save	
the	one	who	deserves	the	fire?	(Because	the	hearts	of	some	disbelievers	are	sealed).
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā		woh	jis	par	'aƶāb	ki	bāt	sābit	ho	chuki	najāt	wāloñ	ke	barābar	ho	jāye	gā	to	kyā		tum	
hidāyat	de	kar	āag	ke	mustaḥiq	ko	bachā	lo	ge.

arabicText: لَـٰكِنِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ رَبَّهُمْ لَهُمْ غُرَفٌۭ مِّن فَوْقِهَا غُرَفٌۭ مَّبْنِيَّةٌۭ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ لَا يُخْلِفُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمِيعَادَ
englishTranslationText:
But	for	those	who	fear	their	Lord,	are	the	high	chambers	with	more	high	chambers	built	above	
them	–	rivers	flowing	beneath	them;	a	promise	of	Allah;	Allah	does	not	renege	on	His	promise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Lekin	jo	apne	Rab	se	dare	un	ke	liye	bālā	khāne	haiñ	un	par	bālā	khāne	bane	un	ke	niche	nahreñ	
baheñ	Allāh	kā	w'ada	Allāh	w'ada	khilāf	nahiñ	kartā	.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَسَلَكَهُۥ يَنَـٰبِيعَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ثُمَّ يُخْرِجُ بِهِۦ زَرْعًۭا مُّخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَٰنُهُۥ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَىٰهُ مُصْفَرًّۭا ثُمَّ يَجْعَلُهُۥ حُطَـٰمًا ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	that	it	is	Allah	Who	sent	down	water	from	the	sky,	and	then	with	it	made	springs	
in	the	earth,	and	then	with	it	produces	crops	of	various	colours,	and	then	it	dries	up	and	you	see	
it	has	become	yellow,	and	He	then	fragments	them	into	small	pieces;	indeed	in	this	is	a	reminder	
for	people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā		tu	ne	na	dekhā	ke	Allāh	ne	āasmān	se	pāni	utārā	phir	us	se	zameen	meiñ	chashme	banāye	
phir	us	se	kheti	nikāltā	hai	kayi	rangat	ki	phir	sookh	jāti	hai	to	tu	dekhe	ke	woh	peeli	pard	gayi	
phir	usey	reza	reza	kar	detā	hai	be-shak	is	meiñ	dhiyān	ki	bāt	hai	áql	mandoñ	ko.

arabicText: أَفَمَن شَرَحَ ٱللَّهُ صَدْرَهُۥ لِلْإِسْلَـٰمِ فَهُوَ عَلَىٰ نُورٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۚ فَوَيْلٌۭ لِّلْقَـٰسِيَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مِّن ذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
englishTranslationText:
So	will	he	whose	bosom	Allah	has	opened	
up	for	Islam	-	he	is	therefore	upon	a	light	
from	his	Lord	-	ever	be	equal	to	one	who	is	
stone	hearted?	Therefore	ruin	is	for	those	
whose	hearts	are	hardened	towards	the	
remembrance	of	Allah;	they	are	in	open	
error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā		woh	jis	kā	seena	Allāh	ne	Islām	ke	
liye	khol	diyā	to	woh	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	
Noor	par	hai	us	jaisā	ho	jāye	gā	jo	sang	dil	
hai	to	kharābi	hai	un	ki	jin	ke	dil	Yad-e
Khudā	ki	ṭaraf	se	sakht	ho	gaye	haiñ	woh	
khuli	gumrāhi	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ نَزَّلَ أَحْسَنَ ٱلْحَدِيثِ كِتَـٰبًۭا مُّتَشَـٰبِهًۭا مَّثَانِىَ تَقْشَعِرُّ مِنْهُ جُلُودُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ ثُمَّ تَلِينُ جُلُودُهُمْ وَقُلُوبُهُمْ إِلَىٰ ذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُدَى ٱللَّهِ يَهْدِى بِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَمَن يُضْلِلِ ٱللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُۥ مِنْ هَادٍ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	has	sent	down	the	best	of	Books	(the	
Holy	Qur’an),	which	is	consistent	
throughout,	the	one	with	paired	
statements;	the	hairs	on	the	skins	of	those	
who	fear	their	Lord,	stand	on	end	with	it;	
then	their	skins	and	their	hearts	soften,	
inclined	towards	the	remembrance	of	
Allah;	this	is	the	guidance	of	Allah,	He	may	
guide	whomever	He	wills	with	it;	and	
whomever	Allah	sends	astray,	there	is	no	
guide	for	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	ne	utāri	sab	se	achchhi	Kitāb	ke	
awwal	se	āakhir	tak	aik	si	hai	dohre	bayān	
wāli	is	se	bāl	khade	hote	haiñ	un	ke	badan	
par	jo	apne	Rab	se	darte	haiñ	phir	un	ki	
khāleñ	aur	dil	narm	padte	haiñ	Yād-e
Khudā	ki	ṭaraf	raghbat	meiñ	ye	Allāh	ki	
hidāyat	hai	rāh	dikhāye	usey	jise	chāhe	aur	
jise	Allāh	gumrāh	kare	usey	koyi	rāh	
dikhāne	wālā	nahiñ.

arabicText: أَفَمَن يَتَّقِى بِوَجْهِهِۦ سُوٓءَ ٱلْعَذَابِ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۚ وَقِيلَ لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ ذُوقُوا۟ مَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	will	he	who	will	not	have	a	shield	except	
his	own	face	against	the	wretched	
punishment	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection,	
ever	be	equal	to	one	who	is	forgiven?	And	
it	will	be	said	to	the	unjust,	“Taste	what	you	
have	earned!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kyā	woh	jo	Qiyāmat	ke	din	bure	'aƶāb	ki	
dhal	na	pāye	gā	apne	chahre	ke	siwā	najāt	
wāle	ki	ṭaraḥ	ho	jāye	gā	aur	zālimoñ	se	
farmāyā	jāye	gā	apnā	kamāyā	chakho.

arabicText: كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	before	them	had	denied,	therefore	
the	punishment	came	to	them	from	a	place	
they	did	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
In	se	agloñ	ne	jhutlāyā	to	unheñ	'aƶāb	āayā	
jahāñ	se	unheñ	khabar	na	thi.

arabicText: فَأَذَاقَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْخِزْىَ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	Allah	made	them	taste	humiliation	in	the	life	of	this	world;	and	indeed	the	punishment	of	the	
Hereafter	is	the	greatest;	if	only	they	knew!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	unheñ	duniyā	ki	zindagi	meiñ	
ruswāyi	kā	maza	chakhayā	aur	be-shak	
Āakhirat	kā	'aƶāb	sab	se	badā	kyā		achchā	thā	agar	woh	jānte.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ضَرَبْنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِى هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانِ مِن كُلِّ مَثَلٍۢ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	have	indeed	illustrated	examples	of	all	kinds	in	this	Qur’an,	so	that	they	may	ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	logoñ	ke	liye	is	Qur’ān	meiñ	har	qism	ki	kahāwat	bayān	farmāyi	ke	kisi	ṭaraḥ	
unheñ	dhiyān	ho.

arabicText: قُرْءَانًا عَرَبِيًّا غَيْرَ ذِى عِوَجٍۢ لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText: The	Qur’an	in	Arabic,	having	no	deviation	at	all,	so	that	they	may	be	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Árabi	zabān	kā	Qur’ān	jis	meiñ	aslan	kaji	nahiñ	ke	kahiñ	woh	dareñ.

arabicText: ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًۭا رَّجُلًۭا فِيهِ شُرَكَآءُ مُتَشَـٰكِسُونَ وَرَجُلًۭا سَلَمًۭا لِّرَجُلٍ هَلْ يَسْتَوِيَانِ مَثَلًا ۚ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	aik	misaal	bayān	farmātā	hai	aik	ghulām	meiñ	kayi	bad	khoo	āaqā	shareek	aur	aik	nire	aik	
maulā	kā	kyā		in	donoñ	kā	ḥāl	aik	sā	hai	sab	khobiyāñ	Allāh	ko	balke	un	ke	aksar	nahiñ	jānte.

arabicText: إِنَّكَ مَيِّتٌۭ وَإِنَّهُم مَّيِّتُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	will	taste	death,	and	
they	(the	disbelievers)	too	will	die.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	tumheñ	intiqāl	farmānā	hai	aur	in	ko	bhi	marnā	hai.

arabicText: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ تَخْتَصِمُونَ
englishTranslationText: Then	you	will	dispute	before	your	Lord	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	tum	Qiyāmat	ke	din	apne	Rab	ke	pās	jhagdo	ge.
